member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrCheckResponse(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internally called method to check radio response. Read from the radio for the #PCRAOK and #PCRABAD reply.
member.param: Trys to verify response during autoupdate mode.
member.returns: true - for PCRAOK, false - for PCRABAD, false - and sets ErrRead to true if garbage was read. If autoupdate mode is enabled will return true without overrideAutoupdate enabled.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetAutoGain
member.summary: Get current session's autogain value. Checks #PcrRadio struct for member #PcrAutoGain for the current auto-gain setting.
member.returns: The boolean of the current setting. True/false :: On/off.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetFilter
member.summary: Get the current session's filter setting.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetFilterStr
member.summary: Get the current session's filter setting.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetPort
member.summary: Gets current port / serial device setting.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetRadioInfo(PCR1000.PcrControl.PRadInf)
member.summary: Sets the radio structure and values then updates the radio to reflect them. PcrSpeed and PcrPort are currently ignored due to implementation bugs.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetRfAttenuator
member.summary: Get current session's RF Attenuation value.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetRfAttenuatorStr
member.summary: Get current session's RF Attenuation value.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetToneSq
member.summary: Gets the current session's tone squelch (undecoded version).

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrGetToneSqStr
member.summary: Gets the current session's tone squelch (decoded version).

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrInit(System.Boolean)
member.param: Initialise the radio in autoUpdate mode
member.returns: On success : true otherwise false.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetMode(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current session's mode. Valid arguments for \a mode: - USB upper side band - LSB lower side band - AM amplitude modulated - NFM narrow band FM - WFM wide band FM - CW continuous wave The concept is the same as above ( #PcrSetFreq ) except it accepts standard text for "USB"/"LSB" etc... Use of the pcrdef codes are not necessary, they will be decoded based on \a mode.
member.returns: True or false based on success or failure.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetNb(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggle Noiseblanking functionality. Valid values for \a value are: - true to activate noiseblanking - false to deactivate noiseblanking Sets the noise blanking to \a value (on/off) true/false... checks the radio response if ok, then sets the value
member.param: Value true or false for noiseblanking on or off
member.returns: True, on success otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetPort(System.String)
member.summary: Set the port for the current session. Sets port by closing the filedes and reopening it on the new port.
member.returns: True or false if the serial device can be opened on the new port.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetRfAttenuator(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Toggle RF Attenuation functionality. Valid values for \a value are: - true to activate RF Attenuation - false to deactivate RF Attenuation Sets the RF Attenuation to \a value (on/off) true/false... checks the radio response if ok, then sets the value
member.param: Value true or false for RF Attenuation on or off
member.returns: True, on success otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetSpeed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the speed for current session. First we check to see if the baudrate passed in \a speed is right, if not then we just quietly return false. Then we decode \a speed and set #PcrInitSpeed to #pcrcmd_t version. Then we tell the radio to switch speeds and set baudrate on the port by destroying PComm and reinitiating it with the new baud setting Warning: follow these procedures to use this function. -create the object (at last known baudrate). -call init -call power up -call this function -delete the object -create the object with the new speed setting
member.returns: True or false based on success.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetSquelch(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the current session's squelch. sprintf converts (and combines) the cmd #PCRSQL with the argument \a squelch , such that the argument has a minimum field width of two chars. If the field is less than 2 chars (ie: arg=5) then it pads the field with one zero.
member.returns: true or false based on #PcrCheckResponse to indicate success or failure

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetToneSq(System.String)
member.summary: Sets current session CTCSS. set's the tone squelch for the radio. The default is value 00 for off. The values are \b NOT the hz, but the #pcrdef.h vals, 01=67.0 02=69.3 etc...
member.returns: true or false based on #PcrCheckResponse success or failure.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetToneSq(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets session CTCSS based on a float value. Since the previous method requires the programmer to remember the PCR-1000's internal number that corresponds to the tone squelch frequency, this overloaded method allows the programmer to pass a float, where the float is the frequency (Hz) in question.
member.returns: true or false based on #PcrCheckResponse success or failure. On failure, it turns off CTCSS and returns false.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSetVolume(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the current session's volume. sprintf converts (and combines) the cmd #PCRVOL with the argument, such that the argument has a minimum field width of two chars. If the field is less than 2 chars (ie: arg=5) then it pads the field with one zero.
member.returns: true or false based on #PcrCheckResponse to indicate success or failure

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSigStrength
member.returns: integer value of 0-255 on signal strength.

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.PcrSigStrengthStr
member.returns: null on failure, otherwise a character string with the current signal strenth. This includes the I1 header, plus the last two characters which is the \b hex value from \a 00-99

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.SetComDebugLogging(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes Raw COM Port IO to the Console

member.summary: Sends a raw string to the port

member.name: M:PCR1000.PcrControl.DebugRawSendWait(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a raw string to the socket and waits for a response
member.returns: The port response

member.name: T:PCR1000.PcrControl.PRadInf
member.summary: Stores the important radio information for the current state of the radio.

member.name: F:PCR1000.PcrDef.PCRINITM
member.summary: Init, manual probe \b Warning: after issueing an init DO NOT read(). If you do, the read() will block and wont return. the radio doesn't return data after an initialization. You must close the socket, and reopen it. You wont have to reopen the socket with wierd opts, unless you reset the socket to the state as it was before . \sa PCRINITA

member.name: F:PCR1000.PcrDef.PCRINITA
member.summary: Init, Auto probe \b Warning: after issueing an init DO NOT read(). If you do, the read() will block and wont return. the radio doesn't return data after an initialization. You must close the socket, and reopen it. You wont have to reopen the socket with wierd opts, unless you reset the socket to the state as it was before . \sa PCRINITM

member.name: F:PCR1000.PcrDef.PCRSIGOFF
member.summary: Program should poll status from radio (G300)

member.name: F:PCR1000.PcrDef.PCRSIGON
member.summary: Radio sends status automagically when a change (G301)

member.name: F:PCR1000.PcrDef.PCRARST
member.summary: Signal Strength (PCRQRST) \b note: You have this header plus 00-FF from weak to strong

member.name: F:PCR1000.PcrDef.PCRAOFST
member.summary: Frequency offset Header (PCRQOFST) \b note: plus 00-7F from extreme (-) to near ctr OR plus 81-FF from near ctr to extreme (+)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form

member.name: M:PCR1000.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used

member.name: F:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member

member.name: F:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or

member.name: F:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used

member.name: F:PCR1000.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcSupressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling all inspections for MVC views within a class or a method.

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object)

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name

member.name: T:PCR1000.Annotations.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String)
